comment: weekly modules, chapter readings take about 4-7 hours to complete, then a simple test afterward and that's it for the week. theres four monthly discussions, one is an introduction. reqs for disc. comments are a little strange but he explains it. overall easy class, but get ready to read! I went through 1&1/2 notebooks throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Absolute joke of a professor. For a class taken just to graduate and as a freshman, this is ridiculous. There's a 40 question quiz EVERY WEEK. As well as a monthly discussion post but I have never seen a discussion post with this many requirements. There's a discussion post open for the whole month but only the first week of submissions earn an A?
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Adebayo is very knowledgeable and he's not the worst, but he's not the best either. His quizzes are confusing (sometimes the right answer is wrong). In addition, he will take off points for doing his stated minimum on assignments, when really he should raise his minimum to what he actually wants to see.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: 40 question quiz each week which were really specific and then a monthly discussion post. It wasn't a bad workload but based on the quizzes I was sure I would get a B in the class. There's a final essay which wasn't hard at all. Ended up with an A somehow so I would say overall the class wasn't bad. Doesn't require much effort.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: The guidelines for his course are clear-cut. You must earn 'X' points for 'Y' grade; no extra credit. However, his email etiquette could be better. He can come across as rude or short, making it difficult when you have questions. FYI, he is the ombudsman; if you have an issue with the class, he is the guy you must contact for conflict resolution.

Professor Adebayo is nice and responsive. He grades pretty leniently on the monthly discussion posts. However, there's a final exam essay which he grades more strictly. My issue with the class was the weekly 40-question quiz, the questions were very specific, and you have to know the textbook chapter front and back to even pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: He is a terrible communicator. If you want to learn, do not take this class. The articles you read are high-school level, but the man is rude. I had him online in the spring of last year. He does not understand basic email etiquette. Also, if you have a problem with him (you probably will), he is the Ombudsman for KSU. Embarrassment for KSU.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I definitely don't recommend taking professor Adebayo's course if you are not a history major. He is a strict grader and gives unnecessary work. Weekly 40 question quizzes, 3 Discussions (each of which require 2 comments on another students post and you have to reply to every single student that commented on your post), Final exam essay.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr.Adebayo has been one of my favorite professors. He is kind and passionate about the subject, his expectations are clear and he provides good feedback that prompts further thought and promotes true understanding of the subject. I would take any of his courses if given the opportunity.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: This class was an interesting and educational course! The professor shows his passion for the subject through his teaching. There were discussions and quizzes throughout the course to check our knowledge throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He's a tough grader. Not a lot of assignments though. 1 quiz a week and an essay due monthly. Theres a lot of info in each quiz which makes going through the material a pita
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm not good at history but I felt very confident in his class. There were weekly quizzes and monthly discussion posts with very clear grading guidelines in the rubric. If you put in the work and stay on top of all assignments, you'll do fine in the class. In super fast the answer any questions and extremely helpful. Only test the final paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: GPA BOOSTER!!! TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! This online class was super solid. Pretty easy A with quizzes every week and a discussion post every month. Do the extra opportunity at the beginning of class for those extra bonus points. My one complaint is that the class is only out of 200 points so you HAVE to do all of the work and put in effort.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: As an online class, it wasn't hard. All the quizzes are on quizlet, there are some questions you'll have to search in the textbook since it is open note. Monthly discussions which honestly aren't hard. My only complaint would be having to respond to 4 people and having to respond on your own post if someone comments.

Summer- He's a great professor who will post his lectures online but the tests were really hard. You have weekly discussion posts that are pretty easy to get an A on as long as you do them. Hit at least 450 words and respond to 4 people. 5% bonus points. Most of the information comes straight from the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Test heavy

comment: Professor Adebayo's online HIST 1112 class wasn't bad. Weekly quizzes on McGraw-Hill and monthly discussion posts. Make sure to do those early in advance they're never hard. Final is an essay that's less than 500 words. Great professor, easy class. Take him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Second course & worse professor I have ever taken in my life. He is rude, and makes you feel inferior. Tedious assignments, and marks off for turning your assignment in on the due date. I advise you to not take this course or do not have a life. Even having a balance between work life and school life will make any of his courses unreasonable.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Prof Adebayo was good, classload was very bearable for online course. Weekly quizzes and monthly discussion posts are most of the grade plus a final essay. Enjoyed his class, would 100% take again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: I f I knew I would never take his class. He complicated the class for no reason with ridiculous grading criteria. He doesn't even read the work you submit and makes you feel dumb. I would not take his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I would not take his class again, he gives only 20 mins for 40 questions and has some major attitude. He takes points off even when you turn things in on time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Adebayo's class isn't the worst There are quizzes every week, 3 discussion posts, and one final exam essay. On the quizzes, he only gave 20 mins for 40 questions!!! And with discussion posts, he counted points off even if you submitted things on the due date. Certain grading criteria is unreasonable. He made it stressful for no reason.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: No tests in the class, only quizzes. The quizzes are honestly super easy if you do the practice questions and know how to take open note quizzes quickly. No final, just an essay question. Monthly discussion posts that are easy as long as you post early and reply to 4 people. A nice guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: THIS MAN GAVE ME 20 MINUTES TO TAKE A 40 QUESTION QUIZ. IMPOSSIBLE I COULDN'T EVEN CHEAT THAT FAST I CANT IMAGINE ACTUALLY HAVING TO THINK ABOUT IT I WOULDN'T HAVE TIME TO READ THE ANSWERS. He deducted points for turning my discussion post on the due date? and he said reply to 2-4 people but marked be off for only replying to two. makes no sense
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: If you pay attention in class he will make hints on the questions he will cover in his tests and say things like- "I may test you on this". The powerpoints are not as helpful as reading the chapter- all of the questions come from the book. If you participate and attend, you will make extra points toward your final grade. He's fun, and he cares.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I wont say its terribly difficult but I took it during summer online and we had about 3 quizzes each week, 1 for each chapter lecture video and 1 for the chapters taught that week. The midterm and the final was Essay type question and we had enough time to properly write it out. overall not a bad class to take, he was responsive with emails too
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Adebayo's Modern World History class is one of those college classes where the more time you put in, the better you do. If you take his class, you must be willing to spend a decent amount of time studying and reading the textbook. Let me repeat, READ THE TEXTBOOK. The class itself is not hard if you put in a good deal of effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is so nice and very intelligent! has strong accent so try and sit in the front cause he can get a little quiet/mumbled. He tries to encourage everybody to come to class and takes attendance as well as tallies participation. There are three tests, some pop quizzes, and a research paper. He is easy especially for a history class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Adebayo is really cool. He is also very caring. Not may professors allow to do extra credit work. Attendance and participation matters. He does have pop quizzes. He is very helpful. If you ever need him just reach out. Make sure you get the book and understand what you are reading. Memorize what you are reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Most boring lectures Ive ever had. I actually had to try not to fall asleep. So much content within short periods of time, I couldnt even get up to the rest room without missing huge portions. Not hard if you really study, and very easy homework... but absolutely the most boring.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Wonderful professor speaks softly so sit close. Very passionate about subject & is knowledgeable. I enjoyed him & I'm no history buff (I dreaded the thought of it). Yes, suck it up you must get the book. He asks detailed questions from the text so you have to read. 4 quizzes, 2 essays (250 words), midterm &final (EC- 1 essay)took summer 8 wk term.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: There were 5 tests. They were not particularly hard, I just stopped doing as much of the reading as I should have. Great class though. You definitely learn a lot about the different Traditions. He was very nice and he gave extra credit if we went to historical sites or museums. Of course you have to prove you went to these places. Great class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His online class was well balanced, quiz every week, an assignment once a month, and a midterm and a final. Never felt overwhelmed in class, one research paper that he announced in January that was not due until April. I learned a lot about Africa, major themes, peoples, and cultures. I thought it was a valuable class to take.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback

comment: This class was very easy if you know how to study. I got 100s on basically all my test because I figured out his tests come straight from the book. I read the chapters the night before the test and I would do perfect. You have 4 tests and one paper, one quiz. Paper is graded a little harsh. Extra credit is 5 extra point if u miss less than 3 class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Left class for 2 weeks in the middle and cut off the last week of classes. Most BORING lectures i've ever had to sit through, but overall pretty nice. Lectures also didn't help much on the test, just study the key terms and read the book. Attendance isn't mandatory but counts as extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: AWESOME. Heavy accent but not hard to understand. Few grades.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very boring class/prof, and I love history. Every class is a lecture. Not very helpful when anyone asks questions, but continually tells you he wants you to ask questions. Also, he took 2 weeks off in the middle of the semester to go on vacation. Would not take ever again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is nice but soft spoken so it will be smart to sit near the front. He grades tough and it gets tougher the further in you get. Read all the material he uploads and take notes. You have to attend class and participate in the discussions. Extra credit was very helpful and don't hesitate to reach out to him for help. Course isn't the easiest.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had Dr. Adebayo for the Africans in the Caribbean and Latin America class. It was more interesting than I expected. I always enjoyed listening to lectures and writing the research paper. There were study guides for each of the 2 exams and possible test questions. These were extremely helpful. I thought he graded fairly. I would recommend the clas

Great teacher, I learned alot in this class. He is a hard grader, essay test. MUST READ MATERIAL! DO THE EXTRA CREDIT 1pt.=1%overall grade.Very willing to help. I was struggling and bugged him until I got it. I highly recommend him if you really want to learn something and not just skim by.

I love Dr. Adebayo even though he is a tough grader. I thoroughly enjoyed his class and he worked with me after a family problem.Don't miss more than 5 days or else you will not receive his 5 extra attendance points. The books in for this class are CRUCIAL to have. All of his tests are essay form and you WILL need to actually read them!

Nice guy. Soft spoken. He grades harshly but fairly like said. Few problems. His lectures are kind of bland and don't really convey info that well. You never know what he expects you to know on the test. And the textbook he uses is AWFUL. Worst history textbook I've used at KSU. It literally has no real form or structure.

2 essay tests, 2 papers and extra credit for attendance. Grades harshly & expects a lot so be as detailed as possible on tests. Overall, he's a good prof--monotone and overly detailed, but very knowledgeable.

Dr. Adebayo is a good teacher. He is tough but fair. Do the readings and pay attention to lectures and you will do fine. Make sure to do the extra credit because it may be the difference in an A and a B.
Class can get tough, and grades seem to be done at random. But he is friendly and helpful.
